snippet.title: Fast and robust visual unit tests for your React application ‚Äì Dzianis Artsiukhovich
snippet.description:
Talk recording from React Advanced Meetup https://www.meetup.com/React-Advanced/events/268458369/

# Fast and robust visual unit tests for your React application
by Dzianis Artsiukhovich

During this talk, we‚Äôll consider different techniques of UI testing.
Discuss the difference and pros/cons of various approaches of UI testing, such as plugins for e2e tests, visual testing with storybook, their challenges.

And then discover how to implement such tests on unit/integration level, which means without server at all and based on SSR. You‚Äôll see why and how we use visual unit tests at DAZN. Then you‚Äôll learn how to implement such tests from scratch step by step based on small React application. We‚Äôll also talk about the performance of such tests and about the integration into a pipeline.

About Dzianis

Senior Software Engineer and active open source contributor. From Minsk, but now based in London and work at DAZN. I like playing around with TS, React, Redux, MobX/MST, RxJS, WebGL, Serverless, Node, Functional Programming with a focus on performance, system architecture and team productivity.

¬†
Subscribe to our channel to see more React (Native) talks: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsFrt8oKNYXGspSlX9u6uXw/

snippet.title: Reacting to Tech Debt ‚Äì Leonardo Garcia-Crespo
snippet.description:
Talk recording from React Advanced Meetup https://www.meetup.com/React-Advanced/events/268458369/

# Reacting to Tech Debt
by Leonardo Garcia-Crespo

TweetDeck is a complex application with a massive codebase that‚Äôs been around for more than 10 years. It started as an Adobe Air app, but the current codebase really started as a Chrome Web Store app. It once powered a windows app, and now it is a single-page app that is accessed in a browser but also as a Mac app. It went through countless refactors, tech stacks, feature additions, removals and modifications, and lots of bugfixes and workarounds for now old browsers.

As such, it accumulated technical debt and a lot of different coding paradigms. However, we managed to introduce React and successfully migrate several parts of the application, which allowed us to start moving faster again in those places. In this talk I want to show how we did that, some techniques and problems to solve when migrating an old codebase into React, and also learn to love what React gives us by looking at the problems we had before and how React removes them.

About Leonardo (https://twitter.com/leogcrespo)

Software Developer at Twitter. Argentinian living in London. Loves frontend, music and dad jokes.

¬†
Subscribe to our channel to see more React (Native) talks: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsFrt8oKNYXGspSlX9u6uXw/

snippet.title: Hunt for the Scrolly Grail ‚Äì Paul McCabe
snippet.description:
## "Hunt for the Scrolly Grail" by Paul McCabe

Making a grid or large table, with nice scrolling interactions, fixed headers and fixed columns, is more difficult than you might think in react-native. This talk is about how you can go about searching for your 'holy grail' of scrolling grids.

About Paul (https://github.com/bilewinters/)

A software engineer from London, working on react native apps for Anaplan, with a history in fintech backends. He doesn't know how he ended up doing react front ends, but he is loving it.

¬†
Subscribe to our channel to see more React (Native) talks: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsFrt8oKNYXGspSlX9u6uXw/

snippet.title: React refactoring, off the hook(s)! ‚Äì Marco Cedaro
snippet.description:
## "React refactoring, off the hook(s)!" by Marco Cedaro

React Hooks are going to change the way we write React components and apps. Let‚Äôs explore together the refactoring of a real world app with hooks, introducing the concept and exploring how the mental model of components has to evolve breaking the dichotomy of stateful class vs stateless ‚Äúfunctional‚Äù components. We are going to deep dive in the code of the app, a quite busy stateful component, looking at how we could use hooks to refactor it.

About Marco (https://twitter.com/cedmax)

Webmaster before it was cool, pixel pusher, javascript-something, conference organiser, father of two, but mostly known for yelling at clouds.

Tech lead at Cond√© Nast International.

¬†
Subscribe to our channel to see more React (Native) talks: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsFrt8oKNYXGspSlX9u6uXw/

snippet.title: Frontend Application Bundles: the Docker of Frontend ‚Äì Glen Maddern
snippet.description:
## "Frontend Application Bundles: the Docker of Frontend" by Glen Maddern

Frontend apps are on the cusp of a revolution‚ÄîReact is about to launch a streaming server renderer that massively improves performance on both low-end and high-end devices. It's a new dawn for performance & accessibility, but raises another question? How should we host the server component? Can we do that without vendor lock-in?

Enter FABs, a portable, compact, immutable, server-side JS format that lets you deploy anything from static sites or Next.js to full custom server-rendered React apps anywhere that can run JS, like Cloudflare Workers, Lambda@Edge, Now, etc. Come check it out!

About Glen (https://twitter.com/glenmaddern)

Local business owner and cat enthusiast. Founder/CTO of @linc_bot. Co-creator @fab_spec, styled-components, CSS Modules.

¬†
Subscribe to our channel to see more React (Native) talks: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsFrt8oKNYXGspSlX9u6uXw/

snippet.title: Using monorepos to supercharge development - Dmitri Grabov
snippet.description:
Talk recording from React Advanced Meetup https://www.meetup.com/React-Advanced/events/263229863/

## Using monorepos to supercharge development
by Dmitri Grabov (https://twitter.com/dmitrigrabov)

Dmitri has spent 6 months researching monorepos so you don't have to. In this talk you will learn all you need to know about what a monorepo is, the benefits it provides, pitfalls to watch out for and how to make it work for you. We will examine how monorepos enable us to accelerate component library development. Along the way we look at some of the tooling involved such as Yarn Worspaces, Lerna, Rollup, npm and Storybook. You will lean about the concepts involved, trade-offs to consider and how monorepos can enable your dev team to deliver at scale.

About Dmitri

Dmitri is a software dev at 11:FS Foundry where he is the building front end for a banking SaaS platform. Previously he set up and ran Constructor Labs, a JS bootcamp training devs from scratch, which helped over 40 people get their first dev job.

¬†
Subscribe to our channel to see more React (Native) talks: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsFrt8oKNYXGspSlX9u6uXw/

snippet.title: Testing Is All About Principles - Alex Lobera
snippet.description:
Talk recording from React Advanced Meetup https://www.meetup.com/React-Advanced/events/263229863/

## Testing Is All About Principles
by Alex Lobera (https://twitter.com/alex_lobera)

Should we use react-testing-library or Enzyme? What about snapshot testing? What should be our code coverage? Those are questions we often hear when discussing testing. Those questions are easy to discuss but the answers won't necessarily make us write more reliable code. Many devs struggle to write tests 1) quickly and 2) that increase their degree of confidence.

Writing good code that is easy to test requires a good understanding of programming principles and how they apply to the libraries of choice. Discussing principles is harder than discussing tools. In this talk, we'll discuss the principles that will make developers increase their test confidence when building React apps.

About Alex

Founder at React GraphQL Academy and LeanJS. Developer and Coach passionate about JavaScript, React and GraphQL. Organizer of the JavaScript London Meetup and other popular meetups in the EU.

¬†
Subscribe to our channel to see more React (Native) talks: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsFrt8oKNYXGspSlX9u6uXw/

snippet.title: Practical Performance for React (Native) ‚Äì Anna DoubkovaÃÅ
snippet.description:
Talk recording from React Advanced Meetup https://www.meetup.com/React-Advanced/events/260425694/

There are quite a few theoretical concepts of writing good a React application, including popular functional programming approaches. However, few take into consideration the impacts these will have on performance of the application. In this talk you‚Äôll find out how some commonly used patterns have an adverse effect on the speed of your app, and how to avoid using them. We‚Äôll mainly explore UI and state management but we‚Äôll also dive into some native-specific issues and look at how to prevent them.

About Anna

Anna is a javascript developer who loves working with new technologies. Currently working at Hive, she does full-stack development to deliver a great end to end solution focused on user experience. She's a frequent speaker, runs workshops, and likes contributing to the community.

¬†
Subscribe to our channel to see more React (Native) talks: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsFrt8oKNYXGspSlX9u6uXw/

snippet.title: Turning an Application UI into an API ‚Äì Narendra Shetty
snippet.description:
Talk recording from React Advanced Meetup https://www.meetup.com/React-Advanced/events/260425694/

In this talk we‚Äôll dive into how at Twilio we ended up architecting a programmable UI platform using React that both allows you to have a fully working UI out of the box but also customize functionality and user experience of it to your needs using the full power of React.

About Narendra

Narendra is a Sr. Frontend Developer at Twilio. Javascript enthusiast. He cares about performance and believes that performance is a key for conversion.

snippet.title: Paging Dr. Static! Wielding types like a surgeon. üë©‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è‚öïÔ∏è- by Marcel Cutts
snippet.description:
Talk recording from opening React Advanced London event https://www.meetup.com/React-Advanced/events/254741173/

Follow us for updates - https://twitter.com/reactadvanced

Do you want nearly all the benefits of a typed codebase with a fraction of the effort? Then this talk is for you. TypeScript! Flow! ReasonML! Elm! All these beasts promise you the world, but we all know they come with work, effort, and risk. How do we optimise the benefits while minimising frustration? Learn to apply static types like a glamorous surgeon: inspecting our tools, identifying critical areas, and demonstrating how to apply our knowledge to get monumental returns for our skilful efforts.

About Marcel

Marcel is a vagabond software engineer whose work has ranged from providing software for satellites, to developing zombie based fitness apps for millions of users. He can often be found courageously flinging himself at emerging technologies to explore what's all hype, what has substance, and what gives you the biggest hipster cred.

¬†
Subscribe to our channel to see more React (Native) talks: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsFrt8oKNYXGspSlX9u6uXw/

snippet.title: Magic in the web of it: coroutines, continuations, fibers, threads... üé© - Sam Galson
snippet.description:
Talk recording from opening React Advanced London event https://www.meetup.com/React-Advanced/events/254741173/

Follow us for updates - https://twitter.com/reactadvanced

The real achievement of React isn't enabling better UIs: it's introducing us to new programming concepts! Join me as I stumble through the jungle of coroutines, continuations, fibers, threads, generators and algebraic effects and try to tell a hawk from a handsaw. When we have oriented ourselves a little better, I will step through the implementation details of how React's new Fiber reconciler works in practice to solve a particular use case.

About Sam

Sam Galson is a Software Engineer at YLD and a connoisseur of arcane ponderabilia.

¬†
Subscribe to our channel to see more React (Native) talks: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsFrt8oKNYXGspSlX9u6uXw/

snippet.title: Tip top testing in JavaScript üèÜ - by Jack Franklin
snippet.description:
Talk recording from opening React Advanced London event https://www.meetup.com/React-Advanced/events/254741173/

Follow us for updates - https://twitter.com/reactadvanced

In this talk we'll dive into the approaches and strategies needed to create a great unit test environment for your JavaScript and React applications. We'll examine what makes the perfect test, what to avoid, and how to use more complex features like mocks and spies to enable you to write tests more easily. We'll also look at some of the common pitfalls and mistakes people make that can really begin to hurt you as your test suite grows.

About Jack

Jack is a Frontend Engineer at Thread in London working primarily with React. In his free time, he‚Äôs usually writing or recording videos for his blog, JavaScript Playground. Jack is also the author of ‚ÄúBeginning jQuery‚Äù (Apress, 2012) and a regular speaker on React, Elm, JavaScript, build tools and frameworks.

¬†

snippet.title: Native Web Apps: Use React and WebAssembly to rewrite native apps - Florian Rival
snippet.description:
Talk recording from React Advanced Feb 2019 meetup https://www.meetup.com/React-Advanced/events/258924199/

## Native Web Apps: React and WebAssembly to Rewrite Native Apps
by Florian Rival (https://twitter.com/florianrival)

Can React and web technologies compete with native toolkits when it comes to making super complex, rich desktop apps? Can we go further and create better-than-native applications? ü§î Sounds like a good challenge!

This talk introduces how React, JavaScript and WebAssembly can be used to write new ambitious apps, or port existing ones - with real world examples! Florian shows how to leverage the React ecosystem to create performant applications: architecture, patterns, typing, useful open-source modules and tooling... and how to go one step further and provide a better user experience as well as a better developer experience.

These apps are not web apps, they are not native apps, they are hybrid 'Native Web Apps' and can provide the best of both worlds.

About Florian

Florian is a software engineer working at Facebook. He was an early adopter of React Native and open-sourced a few modules for it. He is the author of GDevelop, an open-source game making software based on React, WebAssembly, and JavaScript. He also made Lil BUB's Hello Earth, an 8-bit game starring the internet sensation cat, which available on desktop and mobile and powered by GDevelop and JavaScript.

¬†
Subscribe to our channel to see more React (Native) talks: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsFrt8oKNYXGspSlX9u6uXw/

snippet.title: Algebraic datatypes with React - Endre Vegh
snippet.description:
Talk recording from React Advanced Feb 2019 meetup https://www.meetup.com/React-Advanced/events/258924199/

## Algebraic datatypes with React
by Endre Vegh (https://twitter.com/endre_vegh)

How we can leverage functional programming in the frontend beyond pure functions.
Functors, monoids or the dreaded monad. How they can be useful in a react codebase. What problems can we solve and what are the possible tradeoffs?

About Endre

Software engineer at Helpfulpeeps with a deep interest in React, Redux, ReasonML and functional programming.

¬†
